article.title: Ash
article.heading: Products of incineration
article.paragraph: The solid remains offires, such as:

list.listitem: Ash (analytical chemistry), the compounds that remain after a scientific sample is burned; commonly reported as a percentage on pet food labels
Bottom ash, products of coal combustion
Cigar ash, the ash produced when a cigar is smoked
Fly ash, product of coal combustion
Incinerator bottom ash, a form of ash produced in incinerators
Vibhuti, the ash of cow dung and several other substances, used in Hindu rituals
Wood ash, products of wood combustion
Ashes or remains, dried bone fragments left fromcremation

article.heading: Trees and shrubs

list.listitem: Fraxinus, genus of flowering plants in the olive and lilac family
Australian Mountain Ash, common name forEucalyptus regnans
Zanthoxylum(Prickly Ash), genus of about 250 species of deciduous and evergreen trees and shrubs in the citrus or rue family, Rutaceae
Sorbus, genus of about 100200 species of trees and shrubs in the subfamily Maloideae of the Rose family Rosaceae
Sorbus aucuparia, also known as European mountain ash

article.heading: Linguistics

list.listitem: , a letter used in Old English textsNear-open front unrounded vowel, the vowel sound represented by the symbol
sc (rune)(), a letter in some runic scripts and a continuation of the Elder Fuark ansuz
ash, ISO 693-3 code for theTequiraca language

article.heading: People

list.listitem: Ash (name)various people
Ash (artist)(born 1968), French graffiti artist

Ashton Carter"Ash" Carter(born 1954), nickname of Ashton Carter, American physicist, Harvard University professor, andUnited States Secretary of Defense

Ash: A Secret History, a 2000 fantasy novel by Mary Gentle
ASH: Archaic Sealed Heat, a 2007 video game

article.heading: Science and technology

list.listitem: Almquist shell, a command-line interface for computers
Plasma ashing, a process in semiconductor manufacturing
Potash, a common name for potassium carbonate
Soda ash, a common name for sodium carbonate
Volcanic ash, material ejected from the top of a volcano

article.heading: Other meanings

list.listitem: sh, in Persian cuisine, a dish that is similar to soup but thicker, which is usually served hot
Ash (deity), the ancient Egyptian god of oases
AA-5 Ash, NATO reporting name for the Bisnovat (later Molniya) R-4, an early Soviet long-range air-to-air missile
Ash Wednesday, Christian religious holiday
Ash Thursday, Icelandic volcanic events in 2010
